DataElement.preferredName: Somatostatin Analog Therapy Administration Continuing Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not an endocrine drug therapy that uses analogs of somatostatin to treat neuroendocrine tumors will continue to be given.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Endocrine drug therapy that uses analogs of somatostatin to treat neuroendocrine tumors._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Endocrine drug therapy that uses analogs of somatostatin to treat neuroendocrine tumors.

Concepts.definition: Endocrine drug therapy that uses analogs of somatostatin to treat neuroendocrine tumors.
